intro: Megalastrum hirsutosetosum, commonly known as the hairy-setose megalastrum, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a rough, textured surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
